2000-2018 2000-2023, ongoing New York University's Hemispheric Institute of Performance and Policitics is an interdisciplinary institute whose mission is to "connect artists, scholars, and activists from across the Americas and create new avenues for collaboration and action." The collection contains tapes of their recordings, event and exhibition materials, and websites.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical Note
New York University's Hemispheric Institute of Performance and Policitics is an interdisciplinary institute whose mission is to "connect artists, scholars, and activists from across the Americas and create new avenues for collaboration and action." The institute focuses on political engagement and social justice through events, conferences, large-scale international gatherings, performances, other artistic works, and publications. The Hemispheric Institute was founded in 1998 by Diana Taylor, and has grown into an international network of universities and cultural centers across the Americas that collaborate on projects and individual actions concerning human rights and social justice.
Processing Information
In September 2018 collection title was changed (previous title: Records of the Hemispheric Insitute Digital Video Library) to reflect an accretion of materials consisting of the Institute's organizational records. In July 2019, an accretion of exhibition materials created for the institute's 2018 gala was donated, and incorporated into the collection as a separate series. In 2019-2023, the archived websites were added to the finding aid.
Conditions Governing Access
Administrative records and unpublished reports of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation. Access to files spanning multiple years will be opened to researchers based on the date of the most recent materials. Board of Trustees records are closed for 35 years from the date of creation. Materials related to personnel, grievances, job and fellowship searches and applications, and all files that fall under the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) are permanently restricted. Additional restrictions may apply to other materials in this collection. For questions regarding specific restrictions, please contact the University Archives.
Unprocessed accessions are not available to researchers.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

Preferred Citation
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Hemispheric Institute for Performance and Politics Records; RG 37.45; Wayback URL; University Archives, New York University.
Take Down Policy
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Scope and Contents
The website for the Hemispheric Institute houses materials related to performance and politics in the Americas, including online archives with hundreds of hours of streaming video; digital publications (HemiPress and emisferica), trilingual artist profiles, interviews, course dossiers, event listings, conferences (Encuentro), information on their projects and initiatives (EMERGENYC, Critical Tactics Labs, New World Theater, Helix Queer Performance Network, Religion and Politics in the Americas, Hemi Graduate Student Initiative, Transnational Arts Initiative), and committees. The series also includes the website for HemiPress, the Hemispheric Institute's digital imprint. Publications captured in the series include Return Atacama; Dancing While Black: Black Bodies White Boxes; Until We Find You: The Disappeared of Ayotzinapa; Decolonial Aesthetic Practice; How Movement Makes Meaning: a collaborative dossier on dance, dramaturgy and the global refugee crisis; Franklin Furnace: Performance and Politics; Elia Arce; Transborder Immigrant Tool; Art, Migration, and Human Rights; Deborah Castillo: Radical Disobedience; the Virtual Asian American Art Museum; Decolonial Theories and Practices; Devils of the Americas; Six Gestures; Villa Grimaldi; What is performance studies?; Resistant Strategies; El Ciervo Encantado: An Altar in the Mangroves, Ecologies of Migrant Care; Out of the Archive and Into the Streets: El Cusco de Martín Chambi; [ConTactos]; Multiple Journeys: The Life and Work Gómez-Peña; Capital Places; Arte ≠ Vida: A Chronology of Actions by Artists of the Americas, 1960–2000; and Memorias de Miguel: The Hard Work of Love.
Also includes the website for the sixth convergence of the Hemispheric Graduate Student Initiative. The theme of the conference was Intimate Architectures: Displacement, Irruption, and Emergency in the Americas and took place in October 2021. The website contains calls for participants, schedule of the program, and working groups.
Accruals
New site crawls are accrued semiannually. https://ecologiesofmigrantcare.org/ is accrued monthly.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Appraisal
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of hemisphericinstitute.org, hemi.nyu.edu, hemisphericinstitute.org/hemi/, hemisphericinstitute.net, hemi.press, typefold.com, and tome.press in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints. tome.press links were surpressed.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored.
Videos at the hemisphericinstitute.org/en/hidvl domain were blocked in order to remain within data constaints. Videos have been preserved by NYU Libraries at the Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library: http://hidvl.nyu.edu/
